According to the Bureau of Justice Statistics, individuals from higher socioeconomic backgrounds are less likely to commit crimes and more likely to be rehabilitated upon release from prison. Specifically, the data shows that:

Therefore, based on these statistics, it can be inferred that individuals from the rich socioeconomic class are most likely to succeed as reformed prisoners who will never commit a crime again.
